tours.title: Cultural Triangle Explorer
tours.description: Journey through the ancient cities of Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, and Sigiriya. Experience the rich history and culture of Sri Lanka.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Negombo
itinerary.description: Arrive at Bandaranaike International Airport. Transfer to coastal city of Negombo. Relax by the beach.

itinerary.title: Anuradhapura Ancient City
itinerary.description: Travel to Anuradhapura. Visit the sacred Bodhi tree and massive stupas.

itinerary.title: Polonnawura & Minneriya
itinerary.description: Explore the medieval capital of Polonnawura. Evening elephant safari in Minneriya National Park.

itinerary.title: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
itinerary.description: Morning climb of Sigiriya. Afternoon village tour and authentic lunch.

itinerary.title: Dambulla & Kandy
itinerary.description: Visit Dambulla Cave Temple. Proceed to Kandy. Evening cultural dance show.

itinerary.title: Kandy City Tour
itinerary.description: Visit Temple of the Tooth Relic. Peradeniya Royal Botanical Gardens.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: Transfer to airport for departure.

tours.title: Wild Sri Lanka Safari
tours.description: Encounter leopards in Yala and elephants in Udawalawe National Park. A perfect tour for nature lovers.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Udawalawe
itinerary.description: Proceed to Udawalawe. Afternoon safari to see elephants.

itinerary.title: Yala National Park
itinerary.description: Transfer to Yala. Evening game drive to spot leopards and bears.

itinerary.title: Full Day Safari
itinerary.description: Morning and evening safaris in Yala for maximum wildlife sightings.

itinerary.title: Galle & South Coast
itinerary.description: Drive along the coast to Galle. Visit the Dutch Fort. Relax on the beach.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: Visit Turtle Hatchery en route to airport.

tours.title: Misty Hill Country Escape
tours.description: Ride the scenic train to Ella and explore the tea plantations of Nuwara Eliya. Breathtaking views guaranteed.

itinerary.title: Kandy to Nuwara Eliya
itinerary.description: Drive through tea estates. Visit a working tea factory and waterfall.

itinerary.title: Horton Plains
itinerary.description: Early morning trek to Worlds End. Afternoon relax in the cool climate.

itinerary.title: Train to Ella
itinerary.description: Famous scenic train journey. Visit Nine Arch Bridge in Ella.

itinerary.title: Ella & Departure
itinerary.description: Morning hike to Little Adams Peak. Transfer to airport or beach extension.

tours.title: Southern Coast Bliss
tours.description: Relax on the golden sands of Mirissa and explore the colonial fort of Galle. Whale watching and surfing included.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Bentota
itinerary.description: Transfer to Bentota. Key water sports activities.

itinerary.title: Hikkaduwa & Galle
itinerary.description: Snorkeling in Hikkaduwa. Explore Galle Fort at sunset.

itinerary.title: Mirissa
itinerary.description: Transfer to Mirissa. Relax on the beach.

itinerary.title: Whale Watching
itinerary.description: Morning boat trip to see Blue Whales. Afternoon surfing.

itinerary.title: Beach Leisure
itinerary.description: Full day at leisure or optional visit to Matara.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: Transfer to airport.

tours.title: Ramayana Trail
tours.description: Follow the legendary path of Lord Rama and Sita across Sri Lanka. Visit sacred temples and historic sites mentioned in the epic.

tours.title: Adrenaline Rush
tours.description: White water rafting in Kitulgala, hiking across Knuckles Mountain Range, and surfing in Arugam Bay.

destinations.name: Sigiriya
destinations.description: The ancient rock fortress and palace ruin, Sigiriya is a UNESCO World Heritage site and the most visited historic site in Sri Lanka. Known as the Lion Rock, it stands 200 meters high over the surrounding plains.

attractions.name: Pidurangala Rock
attractions.description: Offers the best view of Sigiriya Rock.

destinations.name: Galle
destinations.description: A historic Dutch Fort and UNESCO World Heritage site. Galle is the best example of a fortified city built by Europeans in South and South East Asia.

attractions.name: Unawatuna Beach
attractions.description: A popular beach just minutes away.

attractions.name: Jungle Beach
attractions.description: A secluded bay perfect for snorkeling.

destinations.name: Kandy
destinations.description: The cultural capital and home to the Temple of the Tooth. Kandy is a major city in Sri Lanka located in the Central Province.

attractions.name: Ceylon Tea Museum
attractions.description: Learn about the history of tea.

destinations.name: Ella
destinations.description: A mountain village famous for its hiking trails and scenic views. Ella offers breathtaking views and a cool climate.

attractions.name: Lipton Seat
attractions.description: Where Sir Thomas Lipton surveyed his tea empire.

attractions.name: Diyaluma Falls
attractions.description: The second highest waterfall in Sri Lanka.

destinations.name: Nuwara Eliya
destinations.description: Often referred to as 'Little England', this city in the hill country is famous for its temperate climate and picturesque landscape of tea plantations.

destinations.name: Yala National Park
destinations.description: The most visited and second largest national park in Sri Lanka. It is best known for its variety of wild animals and holds the highest density of leopards in the world.

destinations.name: Mirissa
destinations.description: A tropical paradise famous for whale watching and its stunning crescent beach. A laid-back atmosphere perfect for relaxation.

destinations.name: Anuradhapura
destinations.description: One of the ancient capitals of Sri Lanka, famous for its well-preserved ruins of an ancient Sinhala civilization.

posts.title: The Best Time to Visit Sri Lanka: A Complete Guide
posts.excerpt: Sri Lanka's unique geography means you can visit year-round. Discover which coast to visit when, and how to plan around the monsoon seasons.

posts.title: 10 Hidden Gems in Sri Lanka Most Tourists Miss
posts.excerpt: Beyond Sigiriya and Galle, discover secret waterfalls, untouched beaches, and local villages that offer authentic experiences.

posts.title: What to Pack for Sri Lanka: The Ultimate Checklist
posts.excerpt: From temple-appropriate clothing to safari essentials, here's everything you need to pack for your Sri Lankan adventure.

posts.title: A Food Lover's Guide to Sri Lankan Cuisine
posts.excerpt: Rice and curry is just the beginning. Explore hoppers, kottu, and the street food scene that makes Sri Lanka a culinary destination.

posts.title: The Famous Train Ride from Kandy to Ella
posts.excerpt: Everything you need to know about booking tickets, best seats, and what to expect on one of the world's most scenic train journeys.

posts.title: Safari Tips: Spotting Leopards in Yala National Park
posts.excerpt: Yala has the highest leopard density in the world. Learn the best times, photography tips, and ethical safari practices.

questions.q: Do I need a visa to visit Sri Lanka?
questions.a: Most nationalities need an Electronic Travel Authorization (ETA) before arrival. You can apply online at www.eta.gov.lk. The ETA costs around $50 USD and allows a 30-day stay, extendable to 90 days.

questions.q: What is the best time to visit Sri Lanka?
questions.a: Sri Lanka can be visited year-round! The west and south coasts are best from December to April, while the east coast is ideal from May to September. The hill country is pleasant throughout the year.

questions.q: What currency is used in Sri Lanka?
questions.a: The Sri Lankan Rupee (LKR) is the local currency. Major credit cards are accepted in hotels and larger establishments. ATMs are widely available. We recommend carrying some cash for smaller purchases.

questions.q: Is Sri Lanka safe for tourists?
questions.a: Yes! Sri Lanka is generally very safe for tourists. The locals are known for their hospitality. Standard travel precautions apply, such as safeguarding valuables and being aware of your surroundings.

questions.q: How far in advance should I book?
questions.a: We recommend booking at least 2-4 weeks in advance, especially during peak season (December-March). Last-minute bookings are possible but vehicle and guide availability may be limited.

questions.q: Can I customize my tour itinerary?
questions.a: Absolutely! All our tours are 100% customizable. Tell us your interests, budget, and timeframe, and we will create a personalized itinerary just for you.

questions.q: What is included in your tour packages?
questions.a: Standard inclusions are: private vehicle with driver/guide, fuel, tolls, parking, and driver accommodation. You can add hotel bookings, entrance fees, and activities as extras.
Free cancellation up to 7 days before. 50% refund for cancellations 3-7 days before. Cancellations within 48 hours are non-refundable. Special circumstances are considered on a case-by-case basis.
Yes! All our chauffeur-guides are fluent in English and are government-licensed tour guides. Many also speak German, French, or other languages upon request.

questions.q: What type of vehicles do you use?
questions.a: We offer a range of well-maintained vehicles including luxury sedans (Toyota Axio/Premio), SUVs (Land Cruiser), comfortable vans (KDH), and mini-buses for larger groups.
Yes, most of our vehicles are equipped with mobile WiFi hotspots. We can also provide local SIM cards with data packages upon request.
Of course! Sri Lanka is very family-friendly. We can provide child seats, recommend kid-friendly activities, and adjust itineraries to include rest stops and shorter driving distances.
